label: 孔雀明王
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Sk. Mayūrasana.  So called because he was believed to ride a peacock.  He was considered efficacious in bringing rain, ending floods, healing illness, and protecting women in childbirth (p. 271n).
